intro: Fosterella chaparensis, commonly known as the Chapare pineapple. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Bromeliaceae, native to Bolivia and northern Argentina. The plant is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves that form a central cup, which collects water. It produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in the axils of the leaves. Fosterella chaparensis is adapted to arid environments and is often found growing in rocky or sandy soils.
